name: buzzard
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large European bird of prey (= a bird that kills and eats small birds and animals) that is a type of hawk: High above the banks of ancient oaks, a buzzard circles in search of its prey.
GlobalP/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
a type of North American vulture that feeds on the flesh of dead animals: The highway is a desolate stretch of asphalt haunted by buzzards, coyotes and rattlesnakes.
mallardg500/Moment/Getty Images /GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesDeer, otters & buzzards can be seen from the cottages.The Basque country has vineyards surrounded by purple heather, bracken and honeysuckle; the plaintive cries of buzzards echo in the air.After following some buzzards circling carrion, he came upon the hides of about 10 black bears.The territory offers few distractions but the occasional buzzard gorging on a roadkill.
